did.abstract: Charles ("Charlie") Rasch was a professional pianist, talented photographer, and graduate of the University of Michigan. The collection contains scrapbooks, photographs, and negatives documenting his life in Michigan. The majority of photographs and negatives are labeled with the date and location.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Howard and Rose Rasch (donor no. 10655) in October 2011.

accruals.p: No further additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Charles Rasch Collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: A native of Birmingham, MI, Charles ("Charlie") Rasch was a ragtime pianist, artist, and talented nature photographer. He received both his BA and MA from the University of Michigan, and served two years in the U.S. Army.

scopecontent.p: The Charles Rasch Collection (23 oversize volumes and 5 linear feet) is primarily composed of photographs and negatives documenting Michigan scenery. There is particularly strong coverage of Birmingham, MI, Harsen's Island, MI, the Island Lake Recreation Area in Brighton, MI, and the Bald Mountain Recreation Area in Oakland, MI. Many of these photographs, especially his early black and white work, display his artistic training and sensibilities. Rasch's scrapbooks also offer a rich representation of the ragtime music scene in Michigan and the Ann Arbor area. This collection is also notable for the care Rasch took to annotate his photographs. Many negatives and prints are individually labeled, and all include some information relating to the date and location.
The collection has been arranged in the following series: Scrapbooks and Albums, Papers, Individual Photographs, Photographs, and Photographic Negatives.

The Scrapbooks and Albums (23 oversized volumes and 0.5 linear feet) series is composed primarily of scrapbooks compiled by Rasch, in addition to a family album and an album of photographs of passenger ferries collected by Rasch. The scrapbooks contain clippings, photographs, and ephemera. The scrapbooks contain items relating to Rasch's time at the University of Michigan and his career in music.
The Papers (0.2 linear feet) series contains biographical material on Rasch and genealogical material on the Rasch family.

The Individual Photographs (0.7 linear feet) series contains photographs that originally came to the library framed. All photographs are labeled with the date and information relating to the subject and the location of the photograph. Many also include information on the process Rasch used to frame them. The photographs have been removed from their frames for storage purposes.

scopecontent.p: The Photographs (1 linear foot) series includes photographs taken by Rasch between 1988 and 2005. The majority of the photographs are of wildlife. The series also includes a number of family photographs from the 1930s and 1940s.

The Photographic Negatives (2 linear feet) series makes up the bulk of the collection and includes both black and white and color negatives of photographs taken by Rasch. The series is arranged chronologically, and thereunder by subject or location. Many negatives have been individually labeled by Rasch.
